Keindahan Cappadocia yang Disebut dalam Kisah #LayanganPutus
05 Nov 2019, 12:45 by Bonauli


Foto: Anatolian Balloons Cappadocia

Cappadocia - Kota Cappadocia di Turki ikut ramai dibahas akibat viralnya kisah #LayanganPutus di medsos. Disebut sebagai tempat romantis, khususnya buat honeymoon alias bulan madu, seberapa indah sih pesona Cappadocia?Cappadocia adalah salah satu karunia alam buat Turki. Kota Kecil di Anatolia timur ini berlokasi di dataran tinggi yang dikelilingi bentang alam unik. Dihimpun detikcom dari berbagai sumber, Selasa (5/11/2019), kota ini pun memiliki beberapa destinasi wisata menarik yang populer.Sebut saja hot air balloon yang jadi wisata primadona di Cappadocia. Wisata balon udara ini disebut menjadi atraksi yang paling laris di Cappadocia. Kegiatan ini sendiri dilakukan di Goreme National Park. Wisatawan akan diajak untuk melihat keindahan Cappadocia dari atas udara saat matahari terbit.

Selain itu Cappadocia juga punya Gerome Open Museum. Di sini wisatawan akan diajak untuk menyusuri komplek gereja kuno dan biara yang sudah ada di abad ke-3 dan ke-4. Komplek gereja ini dipahat dalam perbukitan.Bicara soal bentang alam, Cappadocia pun memiliki magnet tersendiri yang terbilang unik. Hal ini bahkan sudah tercermin dari julukan Land of Fairy Chimney, atau Tanah Peri Cerobong Asap, buat kota tersebut. Menilik asal-muasalnya, julukan itu muncul dikarenakan adanya bebatuan seperti cerobong asap di sana. Bebatuan di Cappadocia ini dijadikan sebagai rumah oleh warga setempat sampai sekarang.


Cappadocia

Ada pula Pasabag atau Monk Valley di Cappadocia. Pasabag adalah kawasan batuan raksasa yang mirip jamur. Pada abad ke-4 dan ke-5 ada banyak biarawan yang mengungsi dan bersembunyi di sini.Identik dengan goa, Cappadocia juga punya kota bawah tanah yang bernama Derinkuyu di Anatolia Tengah. Kota bawah tanah Derinkuyu jadi yang terbesar di Cappadocia karena bisa menampung hingga 20.000 orang serta hewan ternak.


Cappadocia

Berkunjung ke Cappadocia kurang lengkap tanpa mampir ke Guray Museum. Museum Guray berisi dengan ke koleksi tembikar.Uniknya Guray Museum di Cappadocia ini jadi museum keramik pertama dunia dan satu-satunya yang berada di bawah tanah. Tiap ruang pameran dipahat dari batu dan berada 20 meter di bawah permukaan tanah.

The beauty of Cappadocia mentioned in the Story of #LayanganPutus
05 Nov 2019, 12:45 by Bonauli


Photo: Anatolian Balloons Cappadocia

Cappadocia - The city of Cappadocia in Turkey is also heavily discussed due to the viral #LayanganPutus story on social media. Referred to as a romantic place, especially for honeymoon aka honeymoon, how beautiful is the charm of Cappadocia? Cappadocia is one of nature's gifts for Turkey. This small town in eastern Anatolia is located on a plateau surrounded by unique landscapes. Compiled by AFP from various sources, Tuesday (11/5/2019), the city also has several popular attractive tourist destinations. Call it a hot air balloon which is the belle of tourism in Cappadocia. Air balloon tourism is said to be the best-selling attraction in Cappadocia. This activity itself is carried out in Goreme National Park. Tourists will be invited to see the beauty of Cappadocia from above the air at sunrise.


Blimp tours on

In addition Cappadocia also has the Gerome Open Museum. Here tourists will be invited to explore the ancient church complex and monastery that already existed in the 3rd and 4th centuries. This church complex is carved into the hills. Speaking of landscapes, Cappadocia also has its own unique magnetism. This has even been reflected in the nickname Land of Fairy Chimney, or Land of Fairy Chimneys, for the city. Judging from its origin, the nickname arises because of the stones like a chimney there. The rocks in Cappadocia were used as houses by local residents until now.


Cappadocia

There is also Pasabag or Monk Valley in Cappadocia. Pasabag is a giant rocky area that looks like a mushroom. In the 4th and 5th centuries there were many monks who fled and hid here. Identified with a cave, Cappadocia also had an underground city called Derinkuyu in Central Anatolia. The underground city of Derinkuyu is the largest in Cappadocia because it can accommodate up to 20,000 people and livestock.


Cappadocia

Visiting Cappadocia is incomplete without stopping by the Guray Museum. The Guray Museum is filled with pottery collection. The Guray Museum in Cappadocia is the first ceramics museum in the world and the only one that is underground. Each exhibition hall is carved out of stone and is 20 meters below the surface of the ground.
